Justification for Mapping: The note could be about the work, expression, manifestation or item, or a combination of them.  But since the MARC record represents a manifestation more than any other entity, map to this. ; lna 2022-05-17
Problems with Mapping: The only superclass for these entities is RDA Entity.   It's unclear whether an entity for a Description Set could be used to apply properties whose Entity relation is unclear.  Mapping to Has note about the Manifestation is temporary pending RSC review. ; lna 2022-05-17
Notes (Uncategorized): Discussion at https://github.com/uwlib-cams/MARC2RDA/discussions/330 .  See alternrative mapping  when $5 is present at the line for $5.

Justification for Mapping: If $5 is present, generate item IRI and treat note as note on item (see $5 mapping)
Transformation Notes:
Mint an IRI for an item, associate it with the manifestation using rdamo:P30103, then apply this property for subfield a content string, (along with mapping the same item to a collection as indicated for subfield 5).
If subfield 3 is present, map it as text appended after the subfield a text - see subfield 3.  -- lna 2022_8_8.
Problems with Mapping: Association of the note string with its "authoring institution" is indirect (the institution is associated with the same minted item IRI).

Justification for Mapping: Needed to retain to provide context for the content of $a; not possible to link or apply to the  portion of the manifestation or item referenced from data in the MARC, so add as a parentetical phrase at end of note text ($a),   ; lna 2022-10-28
Transformation Notes:
The $a mapping could vary (either note on manifestation or note on item, depending on presence of $5).  
As with other unstructured text string notes, the materials specified could be appended to the end of the note text (subfield a mapping) in parentheses with the prefix Applies to, e.g. (Applies to: booklet) ; lna 2022-05-17
Problems with Mapping: Because $3 is unstructured, we don't have enough data to relate this note to a specific part of a manifestation or item.
Notes (Uncategorized): loss of separation of the part specification (not a big impact?)

Justification for Mapping: $5 provides the local, copy-specific context for the note.
Transformation Notes: See example $5 mapping at decision :  https://github.com/uwlib-cams/MARC2RDA/wiki/Decisions-Index#iij-5 .  The minted item URI relates as a holding to a manifestation  (minted IRI)of a collection, with appellation "Collection of [named organization assigned the code in MARC Code List for Organizations]".  This manifestation "manifests" (shortcut) a work (minted IRI, collection, WEMI lock) which has a  collector corporate body (minted IRI),  This corporate body has an identifier for agent that is a Nomen, (minted IRI) with an identifier for agent that is a text string, content of $5, and scheme of nomen provided as a string of  the URL for the MARC Code List for Organizations.
Problems with Mapping: This mapping generates a different item URI for each field containing a $5 in order to  establish a relationship with manifestation and apply notes or other relations according to the field content. The result may easily have redundant item IRIs when only a single item exists, since practice at many institutions results in $5 in multiple fields in description of rare materials or archives.  Data in MARC is not sufficient to identify specific items or relate item data from different parts of the reccord with specific generated IRI identifiers. Item data may thus require manual reconciliation after conversion, depending on the institution's needs.
Notes (Uncategorized): See Subfield 5 discussion https://github.com/uwlib-cams/MARC2RDA/discussions/361 No characteristics can be supplied for the item or association with specifric identifiers based on this subfield. General description from MARC21 Appendix A, MARC Format Bibliographic:  MARC code of the institution or organization that holds the copy to which the data in the field applies.  ; lna 10-28-2022
$7 is a new addition in 2022, needs further discussion --SH 2025-02-11
